org.elasticsearch.repositories

Interface Repository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, LifecycleComponent<Repository>, Releasable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlobStoreRepository, FsRepository, URLRepository

    public interface Repository
extends LifecycleComponent<Repository>
    Snapshot repository interface.

    Responsible for index and cluster level operations. It's called only on master. Shard-level operations are performed using IndexShardRepository interface on data nodes.

    Typical snapshot usage pattern:

    • Master calls initializeSnapshot(org.elasticsearch.cluster.metadata.SnapshotId, List, org.elasticsearch.cluster.metadata.MetaData) with list of indices that will be included into the snapshot
    • Data nodes call IndexShardRepository.snapshot(SnapshotId, ShardId, IndexCommit, IndexShardSnapshotStatus) for each shard
    • When all shard calls return master calls finalizeSnapshot(org.elasticsearch.cluster.metadata.SnapshotId, java.util.List<java.lang.String>, long, java.lang.String, int, java.util.List<org.elasticsearch.snapshots.SnapshotShardFailure>) with possible list of failures

      • readSnapshot

        Snapshot readSnapshot(SnapshotId snapshotId)
        Reads snapshot description from repository.
        Parameters:
        snapshotId - snapshot ID
        Returns:
        information about snapshot

      • readSnapshotMetaData

        MetaData readSnapshotMetaData(SnapshotId snapshotId,
                              Snapshot snapshot,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> indices)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns global metadata associate with the snapshot.

        The returned meta data contains global metadata as well as metadata for all indices listed in the indices parameter.

        Parameters:
        snapshot - snapshot
        indices - list of indices
        Returns:
        information about snapshot
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • snapshots

        java.util.List<SnapshotId> snapshots()
        Returns the list of snapshots currently stored in the repository
        Returns:
        snapshot list

      • initializeSnapshot

        void initializeSnapshot(SnapshotId snapshotId,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> indices,
                        MetaData metaData)
        Starts snapshotting process
        Parameters:
        snapshotId - snapshot id
        indices - list of indices to be snapshotted
        metaData - cluster metadata

      • finalizeSnapshot

        Snapshot finalizeSnapshot(SnapshotId snapshotId,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> indices,
                          long startTime,
                          java.lang.String failure,
                          int totalShards,
                          java.util.List<SnapshotShardFailure> shardFailures)
        Finalizes snapshotting process

        This method is called on master after all shards are snapshotted.

        Parameters:
        snapshotId - snapshot id
        failure - global failure reason or null
        totalShards - total number of shards
        shardFailures - list of shard failures
        Returns:
        snapshot description

      • restoreThrottleTimeInNanos

        long restoreThrottleTimeInNanos()
        Returns restore throttle time in nanoseconds

      • startVerification

        java.lang.String startVerification()
        Verifies repository on the master node and returns the verification token.

        If the verification token is not null, it's passed to all data nodes for verification. If it's null - no additional verification is required

        Returns:
        verification token that should be passed to all Index Shard Repositories for additional verification or null

      • endVerification

        void endVerification(java.lang.String verificationToken)
        Called at the end of repository verification process.

        This method should perform all necessary cleanup of the temporary files created in the repository

        Parameters:
        verificationToken - verification request generated by startVerification() command

      • readOnly

        boolean readOnly()
        Returns true if the repository supports only read operations
        Returns:
        true if the repository is read/only
